title: Can I score 550+ in the NEET by using NCERT and NCERT At Your Fingertips only? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: I can say you can even score 550+ with Ncert only, but all you need is to analyze yourself first… You can do it by taking 2 previous year tests (2013–2014) at this time… Don't try to go for 2015 and 2016 neet papers, that are above level and may decline your confidence… These test will show, where do you stand in reality? How you can attempt 140 -150 Question correct in a limited 3 hr time.. So 1st step is analyzation… Similarly as shown below;    Now you will get aware of your weak points either it is is related with your study or with your paper solving habit or simply brain calculation speed… Yes your brain calculation speed matters a lot…How fast you can process data and get searched out for answer from your complex brain… You can train your brain by playing sudoku ,reading novels and newspapers daily…they will increase your memory power. Get absolutely away from useless social sites… Now 2nd step amendment in your weakness… Revise (compulsory) topics where you got it low…and paste the forgettable one's in your room 's wall so that you don't have to search it in notes like “cattle egret”. 3rd Step Keep on with twice in week major Neet test which can be found in internet easily… If you have completed your course, then it's a bonus point for you …keep on testing & revising.. Well done…Now you have reached to 500 scoring level & you have 1 month remaining..Now you can do a daily major test to just increase 5 marks /day…really you can yourself try it… Also neet aspirants were recommended to watch the video # REALITY OF NEET  Best of luck for the exams!!

Yes ofcourse, Provided you studied Ncert Bio and Chemistry thoroughly(for AIIMS A/R,Ncert Physics also) and then Solve each and every MCQs of fingertips book and Clear all your doubts……. Only NCERT is the book which land you descent marks(at least 550)…. For more go to little bit extra like HC Verma in Physics, MS Chauhan and N.Avasthi in Organic and Physical chemistry resp. But for Bio and Inorganic I will prefer only and only NCERT(Godfather book for NEET& AIIMS). Thank you.
